p: The use of these species crosses continents such as America, Asia, and Africa, and, according to registries, the whole plant or only parts of the plant can be used, with no reports found for the use of the root. The form of use can be both internal and/or external, and the plant is used from a raw to a cooked (decoction) state. In the scientific milieu, a constant need to validate popular knowledge through assays that seek to ascertain whether the medicinal plant has any influence on the growth of microbial populations is seen, whether reducing or decimating them. In the following sections, the results of research in which plants from the Tagetes genus were investigated for their effect on pathogenic bacteria and fungi are discussed.
